definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The cost of living figures out at $300。
Juneau, Alaska's capital, is an expensive place to live.
sentences.chinese: 朱诺，阿拉斯加的首府，生活费用昂贵。
我们的生活费用已上涨。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演说者鼓动群众示威游行，抗议生活费高涨。

sentences.english: How is the living cost different between London and your hometown?
sentences.chinese: 和你家乡相比，伦敦的生活费有什么不同？

sentences.english: Each laid-off worker can receive a living wage.
sentences.chinese: 每个下岗工人可领取基本生活费。

sentences.english: Low maintenance, but the international students can spend a few money while enjoy high quality life.
sentences.chinese: 生活费用低，可使留学生用少量钱享受高品质生活。

sentences.english: The small allowance helps cover the cost of subsistence, and a full time caretaker if needed.
sentences.chinese: 津贴数额虽小，但可支付生活费和全职护理员的工资。

sentences.english: Cost of living was also heavily weighted in the final ranking of Zips.
sentences.chinese: 生活费在邮政区域最终排名中也起了非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: Those wounded or disabled on the job are provided living expenses from the state or the collective.
sentences.chinese: 对于因公致伤致残的，其生活费用由国家和集体承担。

sentences.english: Build dweller lowest maintenance to guarantee route system very necessary.
sentences.chinese: 建立居民最低生活费用保障线制度十分必要。

sentences.english: The petitioner ask for a variation in her maintenance order.
sentences.chinese: 上诉人要求对她生活费的命令的条件进行变更。

sentences.english: The government said they would try to ensure that old age pension kept up with the ever- increasing cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 政府说，他们一定设法让养老金赶上生活费用的增长。

sentences.english: For twenty years past, I have spent at least 10-20 percent of my pocket on books.
sentences.chinese: 二十年来，我生活费中至少十分之二是消耗在书上的。

sentences.english: Rapidly rising living cost is the primary cause of rising endowment amounts.
sentences.chinese: 快速上涨的生活费用是聘金增加的主要原因。

sentences.english: Our holiday plans went phut when the cost of living rose again.
sentences.chinese: 生活费用又涨了，我们的度假计划成了泡影。

definition: to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
rent for a room or house
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to work part time while studying/work-study program
